item.title: Pothole repaired and sinking already, 12th September
item.description:
A cpl of potholes repaired here but both finished tarmac surfaces are extremely uneven and 2 sections are sinking causing cars to straddle to avoid the dips. Would like to see this repaired asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown Lane, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repair in road, 12th September
item.description:
Another repair along this stretch that has been very unprofessionally done. As you come round the corner from Churchdown to Hucclecote you hit a bump which is the newly laid tarmac. Please could this be re done ASAP to a smooth finish as we would expect
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repaired where road was erroding, 12th September
item.description:
Location is on the bend just before the Severn Trent turning. The 'work' has been completed this week but a large bump has been left making this extremely dangerous for bikes and cars, and the whole section is very bumpy. Needs attention ASAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown Lane, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury

item.title: Congestion at pinch point of road and increased pollution, 11th September
item.description:
Traffic persistently becomes blocked due to the pinch point on this narrow road. Horsefair Street needs to be a one way road to ease traffic, prevent road blocks, scratching and damage been done to parked cars and prevention of road rage. The current closure of the A40 is forcing unacceptable amounts of traffic down roads that were never intended for the volumes of vehicles including lorries (despite signage). A pedestrian today was ushered off the pavement so that a Tesla driver could mount the pavement to pass through the congested traffic. The roadblock that ensued around the church at 5:30pm today was just impossible, causing congestion, blockage for an ambulance that was trying to get through, increased air traffic pollution and impact on residents who no longer able to access their homes. This area is supposed to be a conservation area, yet it seems that this is no longer a consideration. The highways services must protect areas that are over 200yrs old and DO NOT have roads to support the acceptable volumes of traffic that now passes 24/7 every day in an around St. Maryâ€™s. An accident or fatality will occur if no action is taken. Please do something now before it is too late!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Horsefair Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding footpath after / during rain preventing access, 11th September
item.description:
At the end of Jasmin way there is a footpath which connects to farmfield road. Each year when it rains the footpath floods and prevents access. This is a main walkway for children walking to school, mums with prams etc. when the water eventually drains away it leaves thick mud. New drainage / soak away needed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Stancombe Grove, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Follow up work required ?, 11th September
item.description:
Web Reference: 7884069 | Enquiry Number: 22082475 (this relates to my pothole report, the one at the top of the hill). .... Hello, there are TWO recently repaired potholes on Hucclecote Lane, one going south (to Hucclecote), just before the crest of the hill / lane, one going north to Churchdown. BOTH of them have a high 'lip' on the leading edge of the patches, that create quite a jolt when driving over them. Is there any way a team can go back and grind down the leading edge and make it smoother please ? Many thanks in advance !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road repair dangerous, 11th September
item.description:
The road (From Hucclecote to Churchdown) was repaired due to subsidence however the repair undertaken has left a significant bump in the road canvass which resultants in cars and bike driving unstable and people could loose control
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
